website_summaries.verdict: A loud, budget-priced carbon monoxide alarm from a reliable company.
pros: Battery drawer slides out for quick access
Green light signals it is working properly
cons: Alarm takes longer to sound for lower CO concentrations

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well, as recently I cooked in our propane fueled stove, and after turning off the oven the detector alarm went off. We then realized that we smelled a bit of propane gas. We could have just gone to bed and had it leaking all night long. But the alarm worked.
customer_reviews.author: CHaas

customer_reviews.title: Simple. Inexpensive.
customer_reviews.text: One of my carbon monoxide detectors had reached it's "end of life", so I was looking for a simple, inexpensive, replacement that just does its job. The Kidde KN-COB-B-LPM Carbon Monoxide Alarm fit the bill. It costs under $15. It runs on two AA batteries. And it installs in minutes. The alarm is loud, and its features are very basic. You have a test button and a couple of LEDs to show the alarm's status. That's it. If you're looking for a fancy detector loaded with features, this isn't it. If you want simplicity and low cost, this detector will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: DLH

customer_reviews.title: Out of date code
customer_reviews.text: This is manufactured Jan 13. It’s out of date, out of code if your town had a 5 year limit like mine and so many others...,,,
customer_reviews.author: Cathi A Hill

customer_reviews.title: This product makes that very easy.
customer_reviews.text: Knowing that all states don't require carbon monoxide detectors in hotels, we have decided to bring our own whenever we travel. This product makes that very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Strickland

customer_reviews.title: DOESN'T WORK
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely horrible. Checked every week, fresh batteries and in proper placement. Did not detect a furnace leak we had. ALMOST DIED!! I had a weird feeling, called the gas company and they came out and found the leak right before we went to bed for the night. If I hadn’t had a weird feeling we would have been dead. DO NOT BUY!!!! NOT WORTH YOUR LIFE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bobert

customer_reviews.title: Buy Another Product from Another Company
customer_reviews.text: I agree with others that say batteries are impossible to install. The unit simply wasn’t accept the batteries. Kidde keeps their phone number hidden until you you go to Amazon to return then a number becomes available.
customer_reviews.author: JTLINVA

customer_reviews.title: User Friendly!
customer_reviews.text: Having just received these today, I can't leave a rating on durability, but I was delighted at how easy they were, first, to get out of their packaging (who ever heard of a rip strip on evil plastic packaging???) and second, to install batteries and place in appropriate places. I ordered one for a propane heater, one for a propane fireplace, and one to give as a gift. Instructions were also easily understood. VERY well pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia K. Teague

customer_reviews.title: Bought these to replace the exact same model because it had worked well.
customer_reviews.text: This Kidde KN-COB-B served us well for many years before needing to be replaced. So we ordered the same unit to replace it. All CO2 detectors only last a certain amount of time and need to be replaced with they start chirping, usually 5-7 years from new. Replacing the batteries is not sufficient. Read the instructions when installing!
customer_reviews.author: California Dreamin'

customer_reviews.title: False alarm
customer_reviews.text: This constantly has false alarms which is beyond stressful. They only happen when everyone is asleep. I am going to relocate the device so it hopefully gets more accurate readings. Right now this product is doing more harm than good.
customer_reviews.author: Carter

customer_reviews.title: Good to have, hope to never use
customer_reviews.text: I tested my smoke detectors when we changed the clocks and found one of them, even with a new battery was not working. They say that they are only good for about 10 years, we have owned our house for 8 and they were here when we bought the house, so bought two smoke detectors for our two upstairs bedrooms. Since we heat with gas, I thought it would be good to add a CO alarm. Have one on our main floor and in the basement with the heating equipment, but nothing upstairs. Nice little unit, runs on batteries, so just installed on the wall. Hopefully will work if we ever need it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Vodra

customer_reviews.title: Good detector but it's battery only
customer_reviews.text: Beware - This is a battery-only unit. I saw "Battery operated with 3 AA batteries included; provides protection during power outages" in the first line of the description and assumed (wrongly) that the batteries were a backup to AC power. Also, this mounts with anchors and screws. I wasn't thrilled with more holes in my wall so I found a spot to rest it instead. If you don't care about the AC power thing, it's more than fine.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Simple and gets the job done using AA batts which I like. Can be a real lifesaver I suggest having 2 in room you sleep.
customer_reviews.text: I'm afraid to rely on just one cheaper china no brand detector so I feel much better having this one as well in the room I sleep. Can be a real lifesaver I've read lots of horror stories like one man who's detector was going off for low batteries so he removed batts before going to work & came home and his wife and kids were dead in their beds. Don't skimp out on these have at least 2 in the room you or family sleep just to be on safe side.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Cost effective to meet the need. Good for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I have hard time to find non-battery operated CO alarm in local H*O*M*E depot and L*O*W*E*S stores. I know CA does not allow selling smog detectors with replaceable batteries. Not sure if the rule now applies to CO alarm detector also. I have several rentals, I usually replace the smog/CO alarm batteries in each spring time during my annual property inspection. This replaceable-battery operated CO alarm detector is cost effective to meet my need. Good for the money.
customer_reviews.author: H. Wang

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT USE IN BEDROOMS
customer_reviews.text: What the description DOESN'T tell you is that it flashes a light every time it samples the air, about once a minute. If you are planning on using it in a bedroom IT WILL KEEP YOU AWAKE. OMG! Too late to send it back as I already recycled the packaging. Other than I can't use it where I need to it operates fine. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Sam's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Small and portable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to take with me on trips when staying in unfamiliar places. My buddy died of accidental CO poisoning while on a vacation.
customer_reviews.author: big_ham

customer_reviews.title: Using in RV
customer_reviews.text: Mounting was pretty easy but the unit is very bulky it is thicker than a fire alarm and because of this you need to mount it somewhere with little to no traffic. Since these are designed to be installed lower on the wall where CO2 settles it is easy to kick or hit with your leg. Other than that it tests and mounts easily and hopefully will keep us safe if there is a CO2 leak. I am using this in our RV as replacing the old one costs three times as much.
customer_reviews.author: e-dude

customer_reviews.title: Protects my family 24 x 7
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what to say but it was easy to install, and protects my family in 2 areas of the house. Never had issues with either one, and it has alarmed (correctly) when a garage door was open for too long with a car running in the garage (very impressed). After 7 years - as per the back panel - it chirped to remind me to replace (every 7 years). I ordered my next pair and hope it'll keep us safe for 7 more...
customer_reviews.author: Peter Sivo

customer_reviews.title: Possibly got a defective alarm.
customer_reviews.text: We haven't had a carbon monoxide alarm and I decided to get one since we are using our heater now for Winter. Reviews looked good and this was well priced so set it up. On Thanksgiving evening it went off. I felt skeptical so put in brand new batteries. Next morning it went off again, very disconcerting. I called gas company and they checked things out and found no issues. I got another alarm and put it next to this one which again went off but not the new one. I feel after having gas company come out that this was a defective alarm so have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall B.

customer_reviews.title: VERY poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: VERY poor quality control. Included batteries seat on one side but don't fit in the sister compartment. Measurements of the two AA battery compartments differ significantly enough to indicate a serious quality control issue.
customer_reviews.author: rick emmerson

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC
customer_reviews.text: I came across this item wanting to replace a $100 detector. I saw that it was exactly the same one I had since I can remember we first installed one. At this price I decided to purchase it again since it worked fine for years. Very pleased. I do not need a digital display for an additional $100. It tells me if there is a carbon monoxide leak and that's all it needs to do. At this price, I can put one in every room if I wanted too.
customer_reviews.author: German

customer_reviews.title: This just saved my Mom's life!
customer_reviews.text: This just saved my 80+ year old Mother's life. I originally bought this because she had lost her sense of smell and she uses natural gas in her home. So I was concerned she might not smell a leak. This morning in the wee hours of the morning it alterted her. I am so glad I was proactive enough to have bought it, or I would be having a very different day today! Well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Economical, Easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: I owned an older one of this same brand. The newer one has 2 batteries instead of 3. It fit on the previous installation so nothing to install other than the 2 batteries. The old one worked flawlessly for 8 years so I'm hoping this will do as well. The fire department looked at the old and said this brand holds up well. It was worth the trip to the fire department as they had helpful suggestions.
customer_reviews.author: LTB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement unit
customer_reviews.text: I had the similar but older model and they apparently stop working after 5 years or some timeframe. Seems to be on purpose. the good news is that you just lift off the old unit from the mount, and slip this one back on the same mount. Could not be easier. Tip: if you have more than one of these in your house, order for all of them because my second one went out a week later and had to order again.
customer_reviews.author: Rod D.

customer_reviews.title: Working good but failed within 6 months
customer_reviews.text: This sensor worked great when it's brand new but it failed after 6 months. I cannot return it as it was out of the return eligible date so I replaced it with another sensor. Wish they make a good reliable and last long product.
customer_reviews.author: HanHan

customer_reviews.title: Note to Self - Do Not Buy Again
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this several months ago and just now have it working. I think. I have been putting it off until I had time to figure out how to assemble it - I kept trying to put the batteries in but they wouldn't stay. The directions are very unclear. Once I finally figured out the battery insertion, I couldn't get the cover to fit. The last one I purchased was so easy - as it should be. Inserting batteries and placing the cover on should be easy - but it wasn't.
customer_reviews.author: P. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Priced right - works so far.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, although I never had any CO to test it, I do check my home with a professional version at the beginning of every heating season. Not much else to say, batteries last a long time and unit is easy to mount.
customer_reviews.author: Cea JaysTop Contributor: Arduino

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy
customer_reviews.text: Have used these in the past. If you use unvented heat sources for a power emergency etc. they are a must. The only thing I don't like are the life timers that a lot of these now use. These can be more or less effective depending on where these are mounted and how high from the floor. More than one and lithium cells work best for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: This was great
customer_reviews.text: My late husband put these up 7 years ago and what are the odds that mine would go bad and so would my tenants on the same day. So I thought I would buy the same brand in hopes I could hang it where the other one was without having to install it. It worked perfectly. I will say when they go bad they are a terribly annoying sound till you figure out what it is. Now that I know the sound I will be prepaired if it goes bad again.
customer_reviews.author: Hard Rock Girl

customer_reviews.title: Set an iPhone reminder for 10 years out...
customer_reviews.text: I’ll be delighted if I never find out how well this works, but we’ve already had our money’s worth in laughs. Instructions say “unit will last 10 years at which time it will beep twice every 30 seconds until you replace it.” WHO is going to help me and my husband remember this 10 years from now when I’m 74 and he’s 86??? However, if it gets to worrying us too much, there’s a “Hush feature that will silence the beeping for 72 hours while we get a new one - ha, ha! Easy install, and looking forward to 10-years maintenance free!
customer_reviews.author: CL3

customer_reviews.title: Unit failed after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: This monitor started continuously alarming (meaning a solid tone, not beeping) at 1:30 in the morning. The manual indicated this is low battery or unit error. Changed batteries and still had a blaring alarm. We could not get the unit to reset. I’d give it 0 stars for the lost sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Justin T.

customer_reviews.title: Direct swap for our old one
customer_reviews.text: Old unit started beeping out of nowhere but it wasn’t the warning alarm. Found out after 7 years it had reached the end of its lifespan. Ordered this one and it was a direct replacement, uses only 2 AA batteries instead of 3 like the old one, and claims to last 10 years now instead of 7 I believe. Cheap, simple to install even if you didn’t have the same one, or one period. Just 2 screws into the wall or even some double sided tape.
customer_reviews.author: BD

customer_reviews.title: I got a bad one
customer_reviews.text: I just put this product together to hang but as soon as the batteries were placed inside it went off and could not shut off by using the test button. I had to remove the battery but when I went to remove the second one it burned my finger. It was so hot! I used a butter knife to pop it out as that's what was handy. 15 minutes later it is still too hot to touch. It's also shows a little melting. WOW! Sure hope they don't give me a hard to returning this. One star is too much for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this detector before and it works great. Never had co from my furnace but my husband was doing some power tool stuff in the basement and it detected the gas from that. So I can say they do work.
customer_reviews.author: A tall girl's review

customer_reviews.title: Cheap protects for ten years
customer_reviews.text: These will last for ten years, after that time, the unit will not work by design. Includes 2 AA batteries that will last almost for the life of the unit. The one flaw is that there is no warning that the unit will soon cease to operate. To improve it, it should give a few weeks warning, which will give you enough time to purchase a new unit. I previoulsy had the unit that lasted for 7 years.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: DON’T BUY THIS ITEM
customer_reviews.text: DON’T BUY THIS ON HERE! I purchased one from Amazon in April 2020 and within 4 months it started chirping. After trying to replace the batteries twice and doing some research I found out the chirping it was making meant that the unit is faulty/dying and needs to be replaced. What a waste of money. While customer service was nice they couldn’t do anything to help because I was a month outside the return window. This item is a safety item for my home and family and I shouldn’t be flushing money down the toilet rebuying one several times per year. Next time I’ll make a trip to the local hardware store.
customer_reviews.author: Bryn R.

customer_reviews.title: Compact Carbon Monoxide Detector
customer_reviews.text: This carbon monoxide detector replaced an identical 10-year old one. It is exactly what I was looking for. It sits unobtrusively on a nightstand in a bedroom. The price was reasonable, as well. If I need another one, I will buy this model again.
customer_reviews.author: Patient knitter

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the nagging lady who bought my house, she was crying about how there wasn't one there. It hasn't gone off so I guess it works. Either that or she'll die and then we'll know.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Service life
customer_reviews.text: Our Kidde Carbon Monoxide Alarm began beeping. How to remove from the ceiling? Quick search on Bing.com showed how. Piece of cake when you know how - just slides out of holder attached to ceiling. New batts - it is clock fall back time after all. Batts did not stop beeping. More reading on web lets us know these things have a 'useful life'. ours was about 8 yrs old - it is time for new one. Very inexpensive. New one just slides in to existing holder on ceiling and old one slides into electronic recycle.
customer_reviews.author: BimmerJim

customer_reviews.title: Non-standard mounting screw spacing
customer_reviews.text: KIt's a fine, inexpensive unit, but because the mounting spacing differs from standard circular dectectors, it can;t replace an existing circular dectector without having to do so patching, painting, and creatomg at least one new mounting hole. Really poor design choice, Kidde. Surely you would expect your customers to be replacing a typicla standard circular unit with this and provide a mounting option for that.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian A. Durlester

customer_reviews.title: Kidde carbon monozide detector
customer_reviews.text: Batteries were easy to install. I was able to test the product. I wall mounted it with velcro strips, as I did not want to punch holes in the wall, and this is how I had installed my previous unit which had aged out.
customer_reviews.author: Communicator

customer_reviews.title: I think it works?
customer_reviews.text: Hopefully I never have to find out that its functional. No news is good news I suppose. The three star rating is because of how incredibly cheap and plasticky this thing feels. I bought a couple based on the good reviews, but I wish I had known just how flimsy this thing felt. However, for the price I would pick it again over something nicer and way more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Josh R

customer_reviews.title: Saved my life
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up when I installed a new wood stove, just in case. Good thing I did. First night I lit a fire it went off and woke us up because of an airflow issue with the stove.
customer_reviews.author: Mike609

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work.
customer_reviews.text: Since I got this, I have not died of carbon monoxide
customer_reviews.author: James Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Kidde Carbon Monoxide Detector Lifespan
customer_reviews.text: Manufacture date of April 2019 (my two). These units have a life of 10 years, then become non-functional and need to be replaced. I have had these in my house for many years, and have had two others last 8 years, obviously 2 years short of their predicted lifespan. Other than that, I can say they are a good bargain and pray they work if ever needed to detect carbon monoxide.
customer_reviews.author: J. French

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the product. L
customer_reviews.text: As some have said, the batteries were a little challenging to fit, but not as bad as others have claimed. It is easy to press the “test” button when wrestling with the batteries, as I found out the hard way, but now it sits quietly (mercifully) on the floor between the furnace room and the living room where the gas appliances are.
customer_reviews.author: Lee McDowall

customer_reviews.title: Constant false alarms
customer_reviews.text: I installed these on my boat to warn me if there was a CO problem. They both alarm when there was no possibility of carbon monoxide. No motors running, stove off, just fresh air blowing through the boat. I tried replacing the batteries and cleaning everything. But they would alarm at 3 am, or mid afternoon....I have no idea what sets them off.
customer_reviews.author: Sailor_mex

customer_reviews.title: Product appears to be refurbished
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased the alarm, I thought it was brand new since nowhere on the description states it was refurbished. The packaging was nice, but I noticed scratch marks on the battery cover when I put the batteries in. It look just like the old one I have, so I was sure it was refurbished. It doesn't say on the description that it is, but from the shape of the product looks, I would say I am 90% confidence to say it is refurbished.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Does The Job for Years
customer_reviews.text: My last two (same model) lasted 8 solid years of use before the "end of life" mode activated. Well worth it and I'm a customer for life as long as they hold up for the same amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Justin W.

customer_reviews.title: Safety First
customer_reviews.text: I am rating this high, but I have no way to verify if it actually works. I have this in our basement where my daughter has a room and I worry about carbon monoxide.
customer_reviews.author: ReviewLP

customer_reviews.title: To go with existing smoke detector
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Peace of mind. We have a combination smoke detector/CO detector upstairs near the furnace, presumably the only place CO would enter. We live in a teeny tiny condo, but the City inspector said we need smoke and CO detectors on every floor and in every bedroom. We already had a smoke detector downstairs, so we got this CO alarm to go with.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper Queen

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to stay safe
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing to complain about. I purchased it to replace a similar Kidde product that failed after many years of reliable service. Easy as hanging a picture.
customer_reviews.author: John Sciacchitano

customer_reviews.title: IT LITERALLY 'WENT OFF' TEN YEARS LATER!!!! JUST LIKE THEY SAID IT WOULD!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I actually called the fire department. they tested and found no carbon monoxide leak. I tried new batteries and the alarm was STILL going off.... then I realized -- I probably put this alarm in TEN YEARS ago -- and they SAID it would go off in ten years!!!! so I bought a new one. and if I live long enough -- it will go off again ten years from now LOL
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Never figured it out. It just kept beeping even when I tried it outdoors. I read the beep meanings and manual etc and it just keeps on acting like it’s detecting carbon monoxide. If I’m using it wrong then this is a terrible product with horrible usability because even with manual and online help I can’t get it to work how it’s supposed to. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Catlheesi

customer_reviews.title: No way to know if it works
customer_reviews.text: It's installed and functional with no way of knowing whether or not it will, in fact, sound an alarm when and if there is carbon monoxide at harmful levels. It looks nice. It was shipped quickly, and arrived that way. The price was affordable and if it doesn't kill anyone I will be able to comment on it's accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: DPG70

customer_reviews.title: 2 weeks of use and it stopped working
customer_reviews.text: i don't have the packaging any longer so i guess its not returnable.. so disappointed with this purchase...this is the exact product we had for 10 years, and the replacement we bought only worked for 2 weeks and the green light is out and it keeps beeping. new batteries, and no CO2 leaks.... malfunction...cannot trust it to do its job!
customer_reviews.author: Humpty Dumpty

customer_reviews.title: It works?
customer_reviews.text: In all honesty Im not sure how I could tell if it is working or not but I had to replace some old ones that just kept beeping and I believe were broken. Apparently you should replace these devices on a regular basis which I haven't been. Everything was easy to install and I really have no complaints as of yet.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Good buy.
customer_reviews.text: Product was manufactured in 2018 so I know its good until 2028. Which means the company does a good job sending people products that’s just been made so it lasts 10 years. When you get your product, make sure to look in the back and make sure it’s recently manufactured. Carbon monoxide detectors lasts only 10 years before needing replacement. People made reviews where the product goes off randomly. It hasn’t happened with me, and I bought 4 of these. No problems so far. I’m happy with it. I feel safe at night.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy N

customer_reviews.title: Portable!  Life you save may be your own.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take with me on business trips and family vacations. Have stayed in AirBnBs and VRBOs that leave me with the feeling that owners cut corners to do maintenance themselves, if at all. Carbon monoxide kills...period. This is inexpensive insurance to prevent anything fatal from occurring. I merely remove the 2 AA batteries when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Haggis

customer_reviews.title: Peace of Mind!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Put the batteries in, ran the self test - and it's not gone off yet. :) I bought this model and the other with the digital readout from Kidde, just to see if the digital version had more information while in operation - I didn't really have to, they both just sit there (I didin't wall mount them) remaining silent. It's nice to know and a comfort, that the "silent killer" is now being monitored in my home.
customer_reviews.author: G2air

customer_reviews.title: Fits mounting plate for older models
customer_reviews.text: I mainly bought this to replace one that had gone bad in my apartment, it had a special chirp for end of life. I chose it because I didn't want to remount the back plate to the wall (plaster, ugh). The new model has one less battery, but still fits the old mounting plate, with just a little wiggle room. I can't really speak to accuracy or longevity, since I have no idea how old the prior model was.
customer_reviews.author: NamesAreHard

customer_reviews.title: A great dog repellant
customer_reviews.text: One small annoyance - you can’t close the battery compartment door when the batteries are removed for long term storage. One big annoyance - the slightest beep drives on of my 3 dogs crazy and it takes hours for her to get settled. Take your dog to someone with an alarm and try a test to see what is your dog’s reaction so you can make an informed purchase.
customer_reviews.author: DEK

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Who knew you need to replace your cO2 monitors every 5-10 years? This was to replace the one we had, which started beeping LOUDLY, which was indicating that it was at the end of it's life span. The monitor is easy to install and we'll definitely buy this again in 5-10 years when its time to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Boecker

customer_reviews.title: Second purchase
customer_reviews.text: Fits the old spot, I just put the batteries in, activated it and slid in on the old mount (dated 2019). The 2nd one I put in the basement, unmounted on top of the gas meter (dated 2018). Reliable, easy of use and a great value. Recommend
customer_reviews.author: ShepLady

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting battery powered detectors...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of these as replacements for my expired carbon monoxide detectors. I like the batter operated version as there is no wiring involved and batteries can be easily replaced. In addition, I like Kidde products and have been using them for years. Works as described without problems.
customer_reviews.author: AL NYC

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I have bought four of these so far. They are inexpensive and a comfortable feeling. I have one in the garage and when I am working on my cars or remote start my car it gives a good warning when the levels get too high. I also have a kerosene heater in the garage and I am uncomfortable using the heater without a detector. They work great.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Sowa

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design of Mount
customer_reviews.text: Since this replaced a Kidde CO detector that had expired, one might expect that you should be able to replace the defective unit with the new unit. No such luck, the mounting holes do not match the unit being replaced. Thus, a new screw had to be affixed to mount the replacement unit leaving an unnecessary hole in the wall. Since I replaced 3 units, three unnecessary holes in the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel R. Shugar

customer_reviews.title: My second one: 10 year life not 7.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the same identical model and brand that gave an audible beep to say it was dying after 7.5 years. However, this one says on the box and inside the unit that it has a 10 year life whereas my other had a 7 year life that lasted 7.5 years. We'll see. But I trust this model since it has proved itself already.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Great basic product for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Good value. I accidentally purchased this thinking it was the model that plugs into the wall, but something like this is better stuck on a shelf out of the way and save the plug for other things. It is well made and it's a great brand so I can sleep better at night knowing my family is safe.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cheney

customer_reviews.title: easy to install
customer_reviews.text: needed one. bought this one. installed it. dont know if it actually works. would hate to find out the hard way.
customer_reviews.author: BINOBINOBINO

customer_reviews.title: Fit perfectly where I needed it.
customer_reviews.text: My landlord had installed a CM alarm in my home about 9 years ago. It failed recently and I had to get a replacement. I picked this one because it was the same brand/model as the old one, and I was hoping the plate would fit so I didn't have to remove it and put a new one on the wall. The delivery was prompt, and although it looked a little different, the plate fit perfectly. Within 2 days I had a functioning unit on my wall.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda Turpin

customer_reviews.title: new replacement
customer_reviews.text: replaced our old unit which reached it's end of life, (beeps every 30 seconds with new batteries). This new unit is exactly the same as the old one but uses 2 batteries instead of 3...so that saves some pennies there. Just installed it so can't comment on functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Z

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Unpackaged this item yesterday evening and installed the batteries. A few hours later, while asleep it starts alarming. It alarms every few hours for no apparent reason. The most annoying thing!! I'm so mad with myself for throwing away the packaging because I want to return it.
customer_reviews.author: New York 101

customer_reviews.title: Great lil CO detector
customer_reviews.text: My Hardwired CO detector was killing my RV battery. This was a great replacement. Due to the small size it did not fill the void left by the original so I mounted it right next to it and just unhooked the original. Tests good. Very Loud.... which is good if you need it!
customer_reviews.author: WinU

customer_reviews.title: I was replacing a Kiddie CO detector that had expired
customer_reviews.text: Turns out CO detectors need to be replaced every 5-7 years. Who knew? My two Kiddie detectors went bad within weeks of the 7 year mark. I ordered this newer model and was happy to see that the rear mounting door is the exact same size as the older I was replacing so I didn't need to drill new holes. Slide out the old, slide on the new. Nice!
customer_reviews.author: MyDigitaLife

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: It's just working away, as it should. It's white-white, too, which I hugely appreciate, since my entire townhouse is white-white, with chrome, and so I haven't had to try to "hide" the device at all. I feel confident, thus far, with it... and am glad I made the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Susie V Kaufman

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT!
customer_reviews.text: Well-made and easy to install. Take the back plate OFF to make the installation a snap. Once it's secured tightly to the wall, just slide the innards over it, and, VOILA ... you're done! Read the manual, tho! You won't figure it out until you do. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Natural

customer_reviews.title: Cheapest Life insurance you can buy!
customer_reviews.text: Cheapest life insurance you can buy. Every household needs several of these. My husband just went through training to be a firefighter and at the end of class he came straight home and we ordered several of these and he installed them. Carbon monoxide poisoning happens more often than you think. It's not worth the risk.
customer_reviews.author: JulieD

customer_reviews.title: Needed replacements
customer_reviews.text: Hmmm, 9:02 pm and my carbon monoxide alarm chirps...ok replace the batteries. It chirps again... find new batteries. Still chirps. Then I realize the basement on is chirping too. Replace those batteries too. Move both of them to fresh air and they continue to chirp. Read the instructions and see they have a 7 year life span.! Time to replace them!!! Replaced with the same ones.
customer_reviews.author: bamc

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive protection against carbon monoxide in the air.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced one that was programmed to stop working after 7 years. That’s when the instrument stops working effectively. The new one will stop working at 10 years. There is no need to buy the more expensive digital model. You just put the batteries in it and off it goes. The batteries in the old one lasted for the entire 7 year life of the unit. It is very inexpensive protection.
customer_reviews.author: Jetarky

customer_reviews.title: Save Lives,maybe your own !
customer_reviews.text: This is a very very sensitive monoxide detector. I mean it will keep barking like a dog until there is no more of the silent killer OR is it just another Happy Trigger thing? Will find out as time passes But surely its better to have one than not.
customer_reviews.author: R. K

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for in rooms
customer_reviews.text: I have a gas heater and carbon monoxide is a concern. But since I am writing this you know that these must work cause I am still alive.
customer_reviews.author: schlemm

customer_reviews.title: Customer support is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these, just like it with 3 batteries instead of 2. It worked for 7 years. That's why I bought this one. I followed instructions, however the green wasn't flashing. I called customer support, the was calm and walked me through. I put the barrier back in and we counted the 60 seconds 2 times in a row, just to make sure it was working properly. I still don't know why it didn't work before. It works just fine now. I'm so relieved.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Wishart

customer_reviews.title: Improved from last model!
customer_reviews.text: New and Improved!! It was time to replace some of my CO detectors and I was excited to find this model only needs two batteries versus it’s predecessor needed three. These are very efficient, have a long life and are extremely easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Good price of easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good detector. The price was right and it was easy to set up. Everyone should have one of these in your house
customer_reviews.author: Mike Hammer

customer_reviews.title: Every home needs one! (Or more)
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and great value for the money, even hough family safety has no price specially when the enemy is invisible. Good quality and i actually thik it's elegant.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco R.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: This exact unit was hanging in our house for 20 years until one night it started beeping. Unsure of what to do, I called 911 and they sent the fire department out to check our house for a carbon monoxide leak. Fortunately the unit was in the process of dying and needed to be replaced. The fire department graciously replaced our dying unit but told us that we should have one on each floor. I ordered two more and am happy to say that they are exactly like my unit that made it 20 years!
customer_reviews.author: H Hunter

customer_reviews.title: I THINK it's working
customer_reviews.text: I keep it in my bedroom just in case. As far as I know, it's working. At what levels it really detects Carbon Monoxide, well, I will have to take their word for it. It does make me feel safer with it in the house.
customer_reviews.author: pleineluneTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one a have bought for a new house they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S. Tyler

customer_reviews.title: This Product lasted me 10 years!
customer_reviews.text: This Product lasted me 10 years! So I bought a new one. The old one used 3 batteries, the new one uses 2 batteries, I was amazed! A great product to have in your home because you never know if the Carbon GAS comes up into our home.
customer_reviews.author: Chubby

customer_reviews.title: Better Replacement
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a direct replacement for an expired unit (after 7 years). The old unit used 3 AA batteries, while the new unit only takes two. The old unit was rated for a 7-year life, whereas the new unit is rated for 10 years. That reflects a very good redesign by the manufacturer. I would highly recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy to find this replacement!
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for a unit of the same kind in my home. I was happy to find this replacement which was mounted on the existing screws. It has a life of about 7 years so I’m good for a long time. It works well!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn F B

customer_reviews.title: perfect swap
customer_reviews.text: Swapped for a unit that was almost 10 years old.. the only difference is that the new unit operates with 2 AA batteries as supposed to 3AAA.... works great and no more annoying beeping...
customer_reviews.author: Manu

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I have no way to test the CO warning device without putting my life in jeopardy. However, it’s easy to install and the regular blinking of the light on the front panel gives me enough surety that it is working. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: BillyBulb

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 while they were on sale, and installed them myself in the house, only took me a few minutes, and I am not handy by any stretch.
customer_reviews.author: Doffod

customer_reviews.title: Good Choice
customer_reviews.text: I’m selling my home... and when the appraiser came to take pictures of my home she took a picture of this with her approval . I’m glad I made the right choice. Shipping was fast and I got it in plenty of time.
customer_reviews.author: K. Quaintance

customer_reviews.title: A must have in a home
customer_reviews.text: Good unit at a good price. Read the pertinent information, these last three years if I remember correctly, their older model I just replaced lasted two years almost exactly to the day as specified.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Vee

customer_reviews.title: Batteries will not install
customer_reviews.text: This product is a piece of garbage. Getting the batteries installed is impossible, they won’t go in. I had the prior model and it was easier to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Neville

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I use a propane forge for blacksmithing, and it does go off when I don’t open up a door or window. Very sensitive. Excellent for safety.
customer_reviews.author: Johannes H. Benink Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Economical, Effective, Easy Install CO Detector
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for the same detector we installed several years ago. The old one lasted 3 months past the expected replacement date, so this is a quality product at a very economical price. We will definitely get this same detector in the future.
customer_reviews.author: RMLANN

customer_reviews.title: Battery compartment faulty
customer_reviews.text: Replaced batteries and they kept popping out of channels which made it difficult to replace cover. If the cover isn't on correct the alarm won't work. If I didn't keep testing the alarm I would have put it back on the wall and it would have been nonfunctional.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Sutton

product_meta.title: Kidde Carbon Monoxide Detector Alarm |Battery Operated | Model # KN-COB-LP2 9CO5-LP2
product_meta.description:
Size:1 Pack| Style:Detector AlarmKidde 21025778 Carbon Monoxide Alarm Battery. Made from quality materials for durability and performance. Designed for quick and simple installation.

AMAZON.COM


 KIDDE 9CO5-LP 
 With the use of sophisticated electronic components, the Kidde 9CO5-LP battery-operated carbon monoxide alarm protects you and your family from the dangers of carbon monoxide. Also included is an intuitive slide-out battery door that gives easy and immediate access to the batteries and a safety feature mechanism that makes the unit difficult to close without the proper installation of the batteries. This easy-to-install alarm is appropriate for all living areas and comes with a 7-year life warranty and 5-year limited warranty. 

 CONSUMER BENEFITS 
 The Kidde 9CO5-LP will alert you and your family with a loud warning signal against the dangers of elevated carbon monoxide levels in your home. This battery-operated carbon monoxide alarm continuously monitors carbon monoxide levels, even during power outages when AC-only units are not providing protection. 

 TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS 
 This unit uses an electrochemical sensor, and when it detects carbon monoxide, it will alert the user with a distinct pattern. The alarm pattern is four short beeps, followed by five seconds of silence, then four more short beeps with a corresponding red LED light. This cycle will continue for four minutes and then change to one cycle every minute until the device is reset or the carbon monoxide is eliminated. In addition, the red LED light will pulse to indicate carbon monoxide has been detected until the device is reset or carbon monoxide is removed from the surrounding area. When there is no carbon monoxide present, a green LED light will flash every 30 seconds, indicating a properly operating alarm when power is present. 

 WHAT'S IN THE BOX 
 One Kidde 9CO5-LP unit and two AA batteries. 

FEATURES/SPECIFICATIONS
 * Battery operated (3AA batteries included) - Provides protection during power outages 
 * Battery lockout system – Deters covering battery compartment without installation of batteries 
 * Slide-out battery door cover – Gives immediate access to batteries 
 * Test/reset button – Tests the unit for proper operation and can also reset the Carbon Monoxide alarm 
 * Low battery signal – Alerts user when the battery needs to be replaced
 * Green LED – Flashes every 30-seconds to indicate the unit is operating properly 
 * Red LED – When a dangerous level of carbon monoxide is detected the red LED will pulse and a loud alarm pattern will sound
